title: How to Make Coffee Creamer

steps.headline: Toast your hazelnuts.
steps.description: Place the nuts in a skillet over medium heat. Cook them until they begin to brown and give off an aroma. Stir them constantly while cooking to prevent them from burning.

steps.headline: Cool your hazelnuts.
steps.description: Remove the hazelnuts and place them on a kitchen towel. Set them aside until they're completely cool. They should be around room temperature and cool to the touch. Fold your towel over the nuts once they cool. Give the towel a good shake. This will remove most of the husks from the nuts.

steps.headline: Blend all your ingredients.
steps.description: Place the condensed milk, sugar, hazel nuts, and vanilla extract into a blend. Blend for about 15 seconds. You want the nuts broken into small chunks but not completely dissolved in the liquids.

steps.headline: Heat your mixture.
steps.description: Heat the blend in a saucepan over low heat. Keep heating until the creamer is warm. It should not be boiling hot, but warm tot he touch.

steps.headline: Steep the hazelnuts and strain.
steps.description: Steeping means soaking dry ingredients in liquid so the liquid can absorb the flavor. You should steep your hazelnuts for about 30 minutes. Strain the liquid into the container. You now have hazelnut creamer.

steps.headline: Toast your pecans.
steps.description: Place your pecans in a skillet. Toast them over medium heat, making sure to stir them constantly. When the pecans start giving off a pleasant aroma, you can remove them from the heat.

steps.headline: Blend your ingredients.
steps.description: Place the pecans, condensed milk, maple syrup, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a blender. Blend until your pecans are finely chopped. You do not want the pecans to completely dissolve into the liquids.

steps.headline: Heat your mixture.
steps.description: Place your mixture in a sauce pan. Cook the mixture over low heat until it's just warm.

steps.headline: Steep the pecans and strain.
steps.description: Steeping is the method in which you let solid ingredients stay in liquid ingredients to absorb the flavor. The pecans should steep for about 30 minutes. When the steeping process is over, strain your pecans into a small container. You now have pecan pie flavored creamer.

steps.headline: Mix equal parts condensed milk and half-and-half in a mason jar.
steps.description: How much you should use depends on how much creamer you want. Use the jar you choose as your guide, adding as much as can reasonably fit in the jar. Make sure you have the same amount of condensed milk and half-and-half. Make sure you leave about an inch of headspace. The measuring does not have to be completely precise, but it can be a good idea to use measuring cups here.

steps.headline: Sprinkle in your flavorings.
steps.description: Measure out the cinnamon and vanilla extract. Pour the spices in with the milk and cream mixture.

steps.headline: Shake your jar to mix.
steps.description: Seal your jar tightly to prevent leaking. Give the jar a good shake. Shake for a few seconds to mix everything evenly.

steps.headline: Chill before serving.
steps.description: The creamer will taste best after it's been chilled. Place it in a refrigerator for at least an hour before adding it to coffee. The creamer will last about as long as the expiration date indicated on your milk and half-and-half.

steps.headline: Add equal parts half-and-half and creamer to a jar.
steps.description: Select a jar and fill it with one part half-and-half and one part creamer. How much you add depends on the size of the jar. Make sure to leave an inch of headspace at the top. For precise measurements, use a measuring cup.

steps.headline: Add your flavors.
steps.description: Measure out the cocoa and espresso powder. Add that to your half-and-half and creamer mixture.

steps.headline: Shake to mix.
steps.description: Close the lid tightly. Then, shake the jar for a few seconds. Keep shaking until everything is mixed evenly and the creamer is all the same color.

steps.headline: Chill before using.
steps.description: You should let the creamer sit in the fridge for at least an hour before using it. It will last about as long as the expiration date of the milk and half-and-half. It's a good idea to write the approximate expiration date on the top of the mason jar with sharpie.
